title: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1: Custom cookie name does not affect URL rewriting
description: In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is mentioned that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). However, the actual result does not match this claim. The page sets a cookie with the name MYSESSIONCOOKIE, but the Reload link on the page still uses the default 'jsessionid' parameter in the URL.
OB:
When accessing the page http://localhost:8080/cookiename/, the page sets the following cookie:
SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly
However, the Reload link on the page uses the 'jsessionid' parameter in the URL instead of using the custom cookie name:
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4
EB: The expected behavior is that the Reload link on the page should use the custom cookie name instead of the default 'jsessionid' parameter in the URL.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Deploy the war file 'cookiename.war'.
2. Access the following URL: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/
3. Observe that the page sets the cookie with the name MYSESSIONCOOKIE.
4. Click on the Reload link on the page.
5. Observe that the URL in the address bar still uses the default 'jsessionid' parameter instead of the custom cookie name.
